Prompt:
Example 1:
Cat and Dog walk. They walk in their village. Then they see an egg. The egg is in the grass. The egg is alone in the grass. The egg is all alone. Cat and Dog walk to a bird. They ask the bird, "Is this your egg?" But the bird says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the owl. Maybe it is his egg." Cat and Dog walk to the owl. They ask the owl, "Is this your egg?" But the owl says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the goose. Maybe it is her egg." Cat and Dog walk to the goose. They ask the goose, "Is this your egg?" But the goose says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the two ducks. Maybe it is their egg." Cat and Dog walk to the two ducks. They ask the two ducks, "Is this your egg?" But the two ducks say, "No, that is not our egg." Then the egg breaks.

Example 2:
The Sun’s light shines on Earth. The light makes our air, land, and water warm. But some things get
warmer than others.
Pretend it is a sunny day. If you wore a black shirt, you would feel hot. But if you wore a white shirt, you wouldn’t feel as hot. The dark color absorbs more of the Sun’s energy. That makes the black shirt warm.
Light colors reflect more of the Sun’s energy. This makes the white shirt cooler to wear. See for yourself! You need a piece of black paper and a piece of white paper. You also need two thermometers and a lamp. Ask an adult to help you.
Fold the black paper so it makes a pocket. Do the same thing to the white paper. Next, put a thermometer into the black pocket. Do the same thing to the white pocket. Then put the pockets under the lamp. Turn the lamp on, and wait for 10 minutes. Then check the thermometers.
Which pocket got hotter — the black pocket or the white one? Do you know why?

Long, long ago, in a time called prehistory, people lived in caves. They hunted animals to eat and made tools to use. The people who lived during this time didn't have any written language. They didn't know how to write or draw. They told stories by talking and making pictures. The prehistoric people also made homes in rock shelters and in the ground. They built fires to keep warm. People also found and used stones to make tools. They used these tools to cut and hunt animals. Some people even made their own clothes. The prehistoric people were very good at making and using tools. They lived during a time that was very different from today. They didn't have cars, computers, or buildings. They lived a very simple life. The prehistoric people made their own tools and clothes. They lived a long time ago, but we can still learn from them today.  (201 words)

Prehistory is a long, long time ago. It is before history. History is what we know about the past. We learn about history from books, pictures, and people who tell us stories. But prehistory is before we had books, pictures, and people who told stories. It is like a big mystery. People lived in caves, hunted animals, and made tools from rocks. They did not have houses like we do. They did not have cars, televisions, or computers. They did not have money or stores. They made their own clothes from animal hides and furs. They made their own food from hunting and gathering. We know about prehistory from the things they left behind. We find their tools, their houses, and their art. A long time ago, there were people who did not write. They left behind rocks, bones, and footprints. People today are very interested in these things. We can learn about the people who came before us. They made tools, hunted, and gathered food. They made homes from sticks, mud, and leaves. They wore animal hides and furs to keep warm. Some people even drew pictures on rocks. These drawings can tell us what life was like a long time ago. We can learn from their mistakes and successes. We can learn about the world before written history. We call this time "prehistoric". We can still learn about the people who lived in this time. Title: The Time Before Written History

Prehistory is a long time ago. Before people could write, they made history by drawing on walls, rocks, and cave walls. The drawings showed what they did. They drew pictures of animals they hunted and things they made. Some of these drawings are still on the walls today. We can learn about the past from these drawings.

We don’t know much about the people who lived a long time ago. But we do know they made things like hammers, knives, and spears. They used rocks to make tools. They also made fires to cook their food and keep warm. People in prehistory also lived in groups, like families and friends. They worked together to survive. We can learn about their lives from the things they made and the places where they lived.

Prehistory is a long time ago. It is before we had written records. It is before we knew how to write. We can’t write about that time. But we can learn from what people left behind. 
Some of those things are tools. Tools are things that people used. They made things with them. People made stone tools. They made tools from bones and wood. Some of those tools were very good. They were very sharp. People used them to hunt and to gather food. They used them to make things. People also left behind pictures. They made pictures on walls and on rocks. Those pictures are very old. They tell us things about people a long time ago. We can learn a lot from them. People also left behind homes. They made homes from sticks and mud.
